content: Venera Arnaoudova â€“ Associate Professor at Washington State University â†“ Skip to Main Content My name is Venera Arnaoudova (pronounced: Ven-air-uhÂ  Are-now-oo-dova). I am an Associate Professor atÂ Washington State UniversityÂ in theÂ School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (EECS). I am currently the Associate Director of the School of EECS and a Voiland Collegeâ€™s inaugural Deanâ€™s Faculty Fellow. Previously, I had the opportunity to work as a postdoctoral research fellow withÂ Dr. Andrian MarcusÂ atÂ The University of Texas at Dallas. I received my Ph.D. degree in ComputerÂ Engineering in 2014Â fromÂ Polytechnique MontrÃ©alÂ (Canada) under the supervision ofÂ Dr. Giuliano AntoniolÂ andÂ Dr. Yann-GaÃ«l GuÃ©hÃ©neuc. In 2006, I received my bachelor degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, and Automation from Polytechâ€™Lille (Lille, France). My research interest is in the domain of software engineering and particularly, software evolution, empirical software engineering, program comprehension, analysis of source code lexicon and documentation, refactoring, patterns, and anti-patterns.
